definition: to tear out (and throw away)/to rip away

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Recently a plastic Santa Claus was ripped off a door.
sentences.chinese: 最近，一个塑料圣诞老人被人从门上撕掉了。

sentences.english: Twist off cap, remove quality seal.
sentences.chinese: 打开盖扭，撕掉瓶口密封。

sentences.english: He tore up a traffic citation for jaywalking in front of the police officer who'd ticketed him.
sentences.chinese: 他当着交通警察的面，把闯越马路的罚单撕掉了。

sentences.english: I didn't tear out the page. It just came away in my fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我没有撕掉这页，它刚好在我手里脱落了。

sentences.english: She tore off her stockings, but the shoes had grown fast to her feet.
sentences.chinese: 她撕掉长筒袜，但是鞋子黏得更加牢固。

sentences.english: We only have one wedding photo, and I tore it in two.
sentences.chinese: 我们只有唯一这张结婚照，就被我撕掉。

sentences.english: He has removed the printed covers, so the boxes are anonymous.
sentences.chinese: 他还把印刷封面撕掉，所以很多盒子都成了无名盒子。

sentences.english: Ninety-eight percent of the people would probably have solved it by taking the stickers off.
sentences.chinese: 百分之九十八的人可能已经通过撕掉标签而拼好了。

sentences.english: As if the toe-nails were all just torn off.
sentences.chinese: 仿佛所有的趾甲都被刚刚撕掉。

sentences.english: The angry man ripped off the big character post on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 这个愤怒的男人撕掉了贴在墙上的大字报。

sentences.english: Tearing away the wallpaper, he found the plastered wall underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他撕掉墙纸，发现里面是泥灰墙。

sentences.english: If it's a smaller window you could remove the backing paper entirely.
sentences.chinese: 如果窗户较小，你可以将贴膜背面的纸全部撕掉。

sentences.english: I tore up the letter and, with tears in my eyes, kissed the hand which held it.
sentences.chinese: 我撕掉了信，含着眼泪吻着她向我伸过来的手。

sentences.english: This book is incomplete, and the secondary one with its second primary chronicle ripped off by someone.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是残次品，本纪第二已经被人撕掉了。

sentences.english: She tore the wrapping away and took out the gift.
sentences.chinese: 她撕掉包装纸，拿出礼物。

sentences.english: Please tear up and throw away the invoice with the mistake.
sentences.chinese: 请把错误的发货单撕掉，丢了。

definition: to tear up/to tear to pieces
to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
to dismantle/to disassemble/to open up (sth sealed)/to unpick
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
to glue/to paste/to adhere/to stick to
